alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 3:39PM MST until March 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. This is for Granite Creek. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Deadly flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to Rain on Snow. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. A stream gage on Granite Creek indicates a stage of 10 feet and is just beginning to decrease. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bannon Creek, Miller Creek, Willow Creek, Hassayampa River, Granite Creek and Butte Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott, Downtown Prescott and White Spar Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 307 and 312...and between mile markers 314 and 316. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
